Description: Fragment of floor with top of foot of Attic black-glazed pottery stemless cup or bowl; short concave neck between bowl and foot (foot lost); glazed black on interior and exterior; impressed decoration on interior consisting of circle of ovules within linked palmettes (parts of three out of six remaining) surrounded by enclosed ovules; underside reserved with central small circle in dilute glaze, circle and band, wide band at perimeter.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

For the impressed design, compare Agora P917 (Sparkes, Agora XII no. 586 pl. 54), a cup-skyphos dated 420BC - 410BC, which has similar decoration on the underside. Piekarski 2001 / p. 46 no. D 3 pl. 18.3.
Bibliographic references: Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p. 46 no. D 3 pl. 18.3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1824)
